conclusion: Problem involves shadows moving when a light source moves.
Four objects on a wooden surface casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
Light source initially positioned somewhere, casting shadows in certain positions.
Question asks how shadows will change if light source moves to the back right.
Need to consider both position and size of shadows.
Understanding of how shadows work: formed when an object blocks light.
Position and size of shadow depend on position of light source and object.
If light source moves, shadow moves in opposite direction.
Shadow's direction is inversely related to light source's direction.
Size of shadow can change depending on distance between object and light source.
Visualization: wooden surface as flat plane, light source above it.
Objects placed on surface, shadows cast directly below or at an angle.
Determine how each shadow's position and size change when light source moves to back right.
Object A is an apple casting shadow A.
Object B is a piece of paper casting shadow B.
Object C is a chicken leg casting shadow C.
Object D is something else casting shadow D.
One object labeled with two letters C and D, possibly a typo.
Assume each object casts one shadow, labels correspond to shadows.
Consider relative positions of objects and how shadows will be cast when light source moves.
